intro: Euodia camiguinensis, commonly known as Camiguin lao, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically the island of Camiguin. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and compound leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
